content: Well, they're email messages, not documents. What you want can be done, but it's work. What you might want to pursue will be separate process, converting eml messages to pdf or doc format. A simple web search for 'eml to doc' or 'eml to pdf' will show many products, none of which we have tested or can comment on. If you pursue this direction, the addon, importexporttools, can readily export messages to eml for you. Then, you would have just a few steps: export to eml, execute the third-party product, and you would then have all of your messsages in your preferred format. Good luck .
creator: davidsk

content:
First, let's clear your setup. you appear to have two accounts, one for info and one for elainemarie. Please do the following so we have a clear view of your status:

  1. click to the SMTP server pane, and click Edit for each one and Change DESCRIPTION field for each to be unique, such as the email address for that smtp server. Currently, i think they both have same description,
  2. now, click 'account settings' and look at account pane bottom line where it links to an SMTP server. Adjust to apply to the correct one.
  3. now, try sending email from each one and then report error message.

The above steps to to ensure that the SMTP server for info is the one used by the info account and the one for elainemarie is using its specific SMTP server. My concern was heightened when your first screenshot was for info and your second for elainemarie. The changes I recommended may not be the solution, but will at minimum give us proper messages.
creator: davidsk

content:
re :is there any one i can talk to over the phone?

Sorry, but No. Thunderbird is a free product. It relies on donations to maintain code, security etc. There are no people managing phones. People live all over the world and helpers live all over the world.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: so can you help me set this up?
creator: elainemariearriola

content:
I notice this..it is asking for 'password' in the error pop up. You have set up account to use Authentication Method: Oauth2.

That means gmail account should be using an access oauth token and gmail server will be expecting that token, so it will never accept the normal password.

When you set up the pop account did you get pop up to logon to google with password and then get another window where you had to click on 'Allow to let Thunderbird access google server ?

Are you using Thunderbird version 128.2.3esr ? If no then pleases update.

Please check you have the following set up:

  • In Settings > Privacy & Security
  • Web Content:
  • Select 'Accept cookies from sites'
  • Accept third party cookies: 'Always
  • Click on 'Exceptions' button
  • Add this: https://accounts.google.com
  • Set it to 'Allow'
  • click on 'Save Changes'

Confirm you have set up as above.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
You need to keep all responses in the original question otherwise the conversation gets broken https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1465127

Please do not create new questions when replying to a question you have already created. You can see all responses via your webmail account using a browser. You can see all repsonses via this Support Forum using a browser.

If you forget where question is then use your profile to see what it contains.It will list any questions you create. This is a link direct to your profile - so bookmark it for future reference: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/user/rayh6444/
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
re : I received your response on my cell phone and tried to respond

If you are reading an email because someone posted a comment in a question you created, then you cannot 'Reply'. When a comment gets posted - the server sends email - it's not a direct email from the person posting the comment.

You will find a link within the email content itself:

There's a button that says something like 'Mark it as solved' which you can use if the info solves the problem.

Next to that button is some text that says 'This doesn't solve my problem' - click on that text link and it should auto open the browser and Support forum and focus on your question.
creator: Toad-Hall
